result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelo B. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Restitution Due to Crime Victim Compensation - Joint/Several $6,592.99

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution joint and several with co-defendants listed in the restitution summary: Frank Martinez, Auston Ortiz and Jesus Rangel in the amount of $20,881.52 (which is inclusive of the 10% surcharge).

Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and drugs. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
No contact with Daniel Sanchez or Steven Solis. 
No contact with their families, their residences or places of employment. 
No contact with co-defendants Frank Martinez, Auston Ortiz or Jesus Rangel.
Court will allow expungment only if all the conditions of probation have been satisfied and that he exhibits a proper attitude during the term of probation and the agent recommends.

Participate in any other assessment or counseling as recommended. 
Provide DNA sample.
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Angelo B. Garcia in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl. Defendant Angelo B. Garcia in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14cF229, 14CM391
8:35 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
  Opposes expungment request that will be made by defense.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.  

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 14CF229 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty in 14CF229.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CM391 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kuhl makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF229 -
3 years prison with 18 months intial confinement followed by 18 months extended supervision - STAYED
428 days credit.
36 months probation: 
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Maintain fulltime employment.
Participate in any other assessment or counseling as recommended.
Provide DNA sample. 
Pay restitution joint and several with co-defendants listed in the restitution summary: Frank  Martinez, Austin Ortiz and Jesus Rangel in the amount of $20,881.52.
No contact with Daniel Sanchez or Steven Solis.
No contact with their families, their residences or place of employment. 
No contact with the co-defendants Frank Martinez, Austin Ortiz or Jesus Rangel.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Court will allow expungment only if all the conditions of probation have been satisfied and that he exhibits a proper attitude during the term of probation and the agent recommends.
Plea hearing at 08-06-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Angelo B. Garcia in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl. Defendant Angelo B. Garcia in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:39 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

- MOTION FOR JOINDER - 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court in support of the motion. 
Court questions Atty Knaapen. 
Atty Kuhl makes arguments to the Court in opposition to the motion. 
Court questions Atty Kuhl. 

BY THE COURT: Motion for Joinder is granted. 

- DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO ADMIT OTHER ACTS EVIDENCE -
Atty Kuhl makes arguments in support of the motion.  Summarizes the motion for the Court. 
Court questions Atty Kuhl. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court.  
Atty Kuhl makes additional arguments to the Court.  Gives notice of new information he has received. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court in opposition to the motion. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds specific acts requested to be included are dissimilar from the facts before the court today.  Court denies the motion with regards to the specific acts of battery or threats to a witness.  That doesn't preclude the defendant from general reputation testimony if lays the proper foundation.  With regard to the incident of pulling a gun, will not be admissible unless reasonable basis of self defense as required under McMorris case. Then defendant can testify to his personal knowledge.  Court will have to rule after hearing the foundation.  Court will not take judicial notice and make part of the record in this case a copy of every file of violent or drug related charges of the Steven Solis and Daniel Sanchez.  Can take judicial notice of conviction if provided by the parties.  Otherwise limited to conviction and how many.  No sufficent probative value for the habit argument has not shown a basis for habit. 

- MOTION TO MODIFY BOND -
Atty Kuhl makes arguments in support of his motion. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments in opposition to the motion. 
Atty Kuhl makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify bond is denied. 

Atty Knaapen indicates he will get information to Atty Kuhl in terms of the number of conviction and provide that to the Court by the end of this week.
Defendant's Brief in Opposition to the State's Motion for Joinder
State's
for Joinder - (state's motion)
Defendant's Motion and Brief in Support of Motion to Admit other Acts and Specifi Instances of Routine Practice
from Defendant - original filed in 14CF229
for Continuance - State's
Jury trial - 12 person on August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angelo B. Garcia in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl. Defendant Angelo B. Garcia in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:47 a.m. case is called.
ADA Knaapen states the appearances on the record.
This is a motion in limine by the defendant and the state has also brought a motion.
Court states there was double booking in Circuit Court Branch 1 so this matter is being heard in Courtroom E.
Attorney Kuhl makes statement to the court 
Court states it needs grounds for the motion from the defense.
Attorney Kuhl makes additional statement.  

9:58 a.m.  ADA replies to statement of the court.  ADA is confused as well.  
10:02 a.m.  Attorney Kuhl replies to the response of ADA Knaapen.  
Court makes statement to the defense attorney 
BTC:  1st request is inadequately noticed.

10:04 a.m.  Court moves onto Motion for continuance by prosecution.
ADA Knaapen makes statement to the court.  
Attorney Kuhl has no objection to continuance and requests additional time to file another motion.
Court questions re: settlement of trial of scheduled prior to this matter on the same date.
ADA responds to the court.  

Court questions re: whether defendant understands this matter will be re-scheduled to a later and whether he objects to the continuance.
Defendant understands and has no objection to the continuance.

BTC:
Court grants the motion for continuance.
Court asks the parties to come to chamber to re-schedule this matter.
Pretrial Motions
Jury trial - 12 person on April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on February 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Atty Lloyd substituted by Atty Kuhl /s/TBE
Status conference on February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on December 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Atty Lloyd
Arraignment on August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court calls cases at 3:18 p.m. Defendants are all in custody.  ADA Knaapan calls for all cases to be heard together.
Co-Defendant cases called together for Preliminary Hearing today: 14CF229 Angelo Garcia w/Atty Lloyd, 14CF230 Frank Martinez w/Atty Raabe, 14CF231 Auston Ortiz w/Atty McFarland, 14CF232 Jesus Rangel w/Atty Arendt.
3:19 p.m. ADA Knaapen calls witness, Kent Lepak, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.  Witness identified Defendant Garcia, Defendant Rangel, Defendant Martinez, and Defendant Ortiz as sitting by their respective attorneys.
3:33 p.m. Atty Arendt (Defendant Rangel) cross exam of witness.
3:37 p.m. Atty Lloyd (Defendant Garcia) cross exam of witness.
3:39 p.m. Atty McFarland (Defendant Ortiz) cross exam of witness.
3:42 p.m. Atty Raabe (Defendant Martinez) cross exam of witness.
3:43 p.m. ADA Knaapen redirect.
3:44 p.m. No further testimony.  Witness steps down.
Each attorney will be heard in regards to their respective Defendant.
3:45 p.m. Atty Arendt makes argument that his client is not involved.
3:46 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant Rangel was a party to the crime.  
3:47 p.m. Atty Lloyd no statements.
3:47 p.m. ADA Knaapen  Defendant Garcia did the action of striking.
3:49 p.m. Atty McFarland makes argument that there is not probable cause for Defendant Ortiz and request dismissal.
3:50 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant Ortiz was a party to the crime - get-away car.
3:51 p.m. Atty Raabe makes argument and request dismissal for Defendant Martinez.
3:54 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant was active in striking/hitting and party to the crime.

BTC:   
14CF229 Angelo Garcia 14CF229 Br 1 case: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

14CF231 Auston Ortiz Br 1:   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

14CF230 Frank Martinez Br 1: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

14CF232 Jesus Rangel Br 1: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

All case to be schedule for Arraignment 08-18-14 at 8:30 am. for 14CF229, 14CF232, 14CF230.  Arraignment for 14CF231 (Ortiz-Atty McFArland) set for 08-18-14 at 11:30 a.m.

Bond on all cases continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Peter C Lloyd in court. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Daniel Sanchez or Steven Solis or their residences.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.
Peter Lloyd appears in Court. 

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm-Party to the Crime.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a $15,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Lloyd makes bond arguments to the Court.  Asks for a signature bond or a significantly lower cash bond.  Defendant is employed at HSU Ginseng Farms.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  6/16/2014  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch
